poem:
**Ebbsfleet**

From chalk and mud, a new world creeps
Between cliffs where Thames whispers—
Dreams in cement dust taking shape,
As far as the eye could wander.

New towns rise on ancient bones,
Hope in each brick's weight,
Housing human breath and
The silent promise of tomorrow.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Can new towns give Keir Starmer the answer to Britain’s housing crisis? The best way to view Ebbsfleet is from a low hill above the muddy banks of the Thames estuary. Here, between the chalk cliffs, ponds and scrubland, a new community is gradually taking shape in what was once a cement works. “As far as the eye can see, all the way out there, will be development,” says Simon Dudley, chair of the public". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
